preface.title: Introduction
preface.para:
The Dictionary Annotator (DictionaryAnnotator) is an Apache UIMA analysis engine that annotates words based on dictionary entries. For each detected word in the document text which is available in the dictionary a new annotation is created.
The annotator can be configured with one or more independent dictionaries for the lookup. The dictionaries can be created easily with the provided dictionary creator command line tooling. For advanced usage of the annotator the matching can be improved by specifying multi word capabilities, match input type properties and input type filtering settings.

chapter.title: Processing Overview
chapter.para: To work with the DictionaryAnnotator at first a dictionary must be created. Out-of-the-box the annotator does not provide any dictionary. To create a dictionary you have to provide a list of dictionary entries to the dictionary creator which immediately creates a new dictionary. The created dictionary can now be used to configure the annotator to lookup words. For each dictionary the output type for the created annotation beside some other metadata capabilities can be configured. The dictionary is able to work with single word entries like "Apache" or with multi word entries like "Apache UIMA".

After the annotator is configured with the created dictionary the lookup strategy settings must be defined. The dictionary lookup inside the annotator is based on tokens. Tokens are used to look for dictionary entries. The kind of tokens that are used for the lookup can be configured and enhanced with filter capabilities. To improve the dictionary lookup the tokenization of the dictionary entries and the tokenization of the document text should be the same. This can be achieved when using the dictionary creator with some advanced settings.

During the annotator processing for each word of the document text that is available in the dictionary a new annotation with the dictionary output type is created. These annotations can in a next step be used to do some further processing.
